63  /** A client for an IPC service.  IPC calls take a single {@link Writable} as a
64   * parameter, and return a {@link Writable} as their value.  A service runs on
65   * a port and is defined by a parameter class and a value class.
66   *
67   * <p>This is the org.apache.hadoop.ipc.Client renamed as HBaseClient and
68   * moved into this package so can access package-private methods.
69   *
70   * @see HBaseServer
71   */
72  public class HBaseClient {
73  
74    private static final Log LOG = LogFactory
75        .getLog("org.apache.hadoop.ipc.HBaseClient");
76    protected final PoolMap<ConnectionId, Connection> connections;
77  
78    protected final Class<? extends Writable> valueClass;   // class of call values
79    protected int counter;                            // counter for call ids
80    protected final AtomicBoolean running = new AtomicBoolean(true); // if client runs
81    final protected Configuration conf;
82    final protected int maxIdleTime; // connections will be culled if it was idle for
83                             // maxIdleTime microsecs
84    final protected int maxRetries; //the max. no. of retries for socket connections
85    final protected long failureSleep; // Time to sleep before retry on failure.
86    protected final boolean tcpNoDelay; // if T then disable Nagle's Algorithm
87    protected final boolean tcpKeepAlive; // if T then use keepalives
88    protected int pingInterval; // how often sends ping to the server in msecs
89    protected int socketTimeout; // socket timeout
90    protected FailedServers failedServers;
91  
92    protected final SocketFactory socketFactory;           // how to create sockets
93    protected String clusterId;

95    final private static String PING_INTERVAL_NAME = "ipc.ping.interval";
96    final private static String SOCKET_TIMEOUT = "ipc.socket.timeout";
97    final static int DEFAULT_PING_INTERVAL = 60000;  // 1 min
98    final static int DEFAULT_SOCKET_TIMEOUT = 20000; // 20 seconds
99    final static int PING_CALL_ID = -1;

101   public final static String FAILED_SERVER_EXPIRY_KEY = "hbase.ipc.client.failed.servers.expiry";
102   public final static int FAILED_SERVER_EXPIRY_DEFAULT = 2000;
103 
104   /**
105    * A class to manage a list of servers that failed recently.
106    */
107   static class FailedServers {
108     private final LinkedList<Pair<Long, String>> failedServers = new
109         LinkedList<Pair<Long, String>>();
110     private final int recheckServersTimeout;
111 
112     FailedServers(Configuration conf) {
113       this.recheckServersTimeout = conf.getInt(
114           FAILED_SERVER_EXPIRY_KEY, FAILED_SERVER_EXPIRY_DEFAULT);
115     }
116 
117     /**
118      * Add an address to the list of the failed servers list.
119      */
120     public synchronized void addToFailedServers(InetSocketAddress address) {
121       final long expiry = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() + recheckServersTimeout;
122       failedServers.addFirst(new Pair<Long, String>(expiry, address.toString()));
123     }
124 
125     /**
126      * Check if the server should be considered as bad. Clean the old entries of the list.
127      *
128      * @return true if the server is in the failed servers list
129      */
130     public synchronized boolean isFailedServer(final InetSocketAddress address) {
131       if (failedServers.isEmpty()) {
132         return false;
133       }
134 
135       final String lookup = address.toString();
136       final long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
137 
138       // iterate, looking for the search entry and cleaning expired entries
139       Iterator<Pair<Long, String>> it = failedServers.iterator();
140       while (it.hasNext()) {
141         Pair<Long, String> cur = it.next();
142         if (cur.getFirst() < now) {
143           it.remove();
144         } else {
145           if (lookup.equals(cur.getSecond())) {
146             return true;
147           }
148         }
149       }
150 
151       return false;
152     }
153 
154   }
155

158       super(s);
159     }
160   }

200   /** A call waiting for a value. */
201   protected class Call {
202     final int id;                                       // call id
203     final Writable param;                               // parameter
204     Writable value;                               // value, null if error
205     IOException error;                            // exception, null if value
206     boolean done;                                 // true when call is done
207     long startTime;
208 
209     protected Call(Writable param) {
210       this.param = param;
211       this.startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
212       synchronized (HBaseClient.this) {
213         this.id = counter++;
214       }
215     }
216 
217     /** Indicate when the call is complete and the
218      * value or error are available.  Notifies by default.  */
219     protected synchronized void callComplete() {
220       this.done = true;
221       notify();                                 // notify caller
222     }
223 
224     /** Set the exception when there is an error.
225      * Notify the caller the call is done.
226      *
227      * @param error exception thrown by the call; either local or remote
228      */
229     public synchronized void setException(IOException error) {
230       this.error = error;
231       callComplete();
232     }
233 
234     /** Set the return value when there is no error.
235      * Notify the caller the call is done.
236      *
237      * @param value return value of the call.
238      */
239     public synchronized void setValue(Writable value) {
240       this.value = value;
241       callComplete();
242     }
243 
244     public long getStartTime() {
245       return this.startTime;
246     }
247   }
248 
249   /**
250    * Creates a connection. Can be overridden by a subclass for testing.
251    *
252    * @param remoteId - the ConnectionId to use for the connection creation.
253    */
254   protected Connection createConnection(ConnectionId remoteId) throws IOException {
255     return new Connection(remoteId);
256   }
257 
258   /** Thread that reads responses and notifies callers.  Each connection owns a
259    * socket connected to a remote address.  Calls are multiplexed through this
260    * socket: responses may be delivered out of order. */
261   protected class Connection extends Thread {
262     private ConnectionHeader header;              // connection header
263     protected ConnectionId remoteId;
264     protected Socket socket = null;                 // connected socket
265     protected DataInputStream in;
266     protected DataOutputStream out;
267 
268     // currently active calls
269     protected final ConcurrentSkipListMap<Integer, Call> calls = new ConcurrentSkipListMap<Integer, Call>();
270     protected final AtomicLong lastActivity = new AtomicLong();// last I/O activity time
271     protected final AtomicBoolean shouldCloseConnection = new AtomicBoolean();  // indicate if the connection is closed
272     protected IOException closeException; // close reason
273 
274     Connection(ConnectionId remoteId) throws IOException {
275       if (remoteId.getAddress().isUnresolved()) {
276         throw new UnknownHostException("unknown host: " +
277                                        remoteId.getAddress().getHostName());
278       }
279       this.remoteId = remoteId;
280       User ticket = remoteId.getTicket();
281       Class<? extends VersionedProtocol> protocol = remoteId.getProtocol();
282 
283       header = new ConnectionHeader(
284           protocol == null ? null : protocol.getName(), ticket);
285 
286       this.setName("IPC Client (" + socketFactory.hashCode() +") connection to " +
287         remoteId.getAddress().toString() +
288         ((ticket==null)?" from an unknown user": (" from " + ticket.getName())));
289       this.setDaemon(true);
290     }
291 
292     /** Update lastActivity with the current time. */
293     protected void touch() {
294       lastActivity.set(System.currentTimeMillis());
295     }
296 
297     /**
298      * Add a call to this connection's call queue and notify
299      * a listener; synchronized. If the connection is dead, the call is not added, and the
300      * caller is notified.
301      * This function can return a connection that is already marked as 'shouldCloseConnection'
302      *  It is up to the user code to check this status.
303      * @param call to add
304      */
305     protected synchronized void addCall(Call call) {
306       // If the connection is about to close, we manage this as if the call was already added
307       //  to the connection calls list. If not, the connection creations are serialized, as
308       //  mentioned in HBASE-6364
309       if (this.shouldCloseConnection.get()) {
310         if (this.closeException == null) {
311           call.setException(new IOException(
312               "Call " + call.id + " not added as the connection " + remoteId + " is closing"));
313         } else {
314           call.setException(this.closeException);
315         }
316         synchronized (call) {
317           call.notifyAll();
318         }
319       } else {
320         calls.put(call.id, call);
321         notify();
322       }
323     }
324 
325     /** This class sends a ping to the remote side when timeout on
326      * reading. If no failure is detected, it retries until at least
327      * a byte is read.
328      */
329     protected class PingInputStream extends FilterInputStream {
330       /* constructor */
331       protected PingInputStream(InputStream in) {
332         super(in);
333       }
334 
335       /* Process timeout exception
336        * if the connection is not going to be closed, send a ping.
337        * otherwise, throw the timeout exception.
338        */
339       private void handleTimeout(SocketTimeoutException e) throws IOException {
340         if (shouldCloseConnection.get() || !running.get() ||
341             remoteId.rpcTimeout > 0) {
342           throw e;
343         }
344         sendPing();
345       }
346 
347       /** Read a byte from the stream.
348        * Send a ping if timeout on read. Retries if no failure is detected
349        * until a byte is read.
350        * @throws IOException for any IO problem other than socket timeout
351        */
352       @Override
353       public int read() throws IOException {
354         do {
355           try {
356             return super.read();
357           } catch (SocketTimeoutException e) {
358             handleTimeout(e);
359           }
360         } while (true);
361       }
362 
363       /** Read bytes into a buffer starting from offset <code>off</code>
364        * Send a ping if timeout on read. Retries if no failure is detected
365        * until a byte is read.
366        *
367        * @return the total number of bytes read; -1 if the connection is closed.
368        */
369       @Override
370       public int read(byte[] buf, int off, int len) throws IOException {
371         do {
372           try {
373             return super.read(buf, off, len);
374           } catch (SocketTimeoutException e) {
375             handleTimeout(e);
376           }
377         } while (true);
378       }
379     }
380 
381     protected synchronized void setupConnection() throws IOException {
382       short ioFailures = 0;
383       short timeoutFailures = 0;
384       while (true) {
385         try {
386           this.socket = socketFactory.createSocket();
387           this.socket.setTcpNoDelay(tcpNoDelay);
388           this.socket.setKeepAlive(tcpKeepAlive);
389           // connection time out is 20s
390           NetUtils.connect(this.socket, remoteId.getAddress(),
391               getSocketTimeout(conf));
392           if (remoteId.rpcTimeout > 0) {
393             pingInterval = remoteId.rpcTimeout; // overwrite pingInterval
394           }
395           this.socket.setSoTimeout(pingInterval);
396           return;
397         } catch (SocketTimeoutException toe) {
398           /* The max number of retries is 45,
399            * which amounts to 20s*45 = 15 minutes retries.
400            */
401           handleConnectionFailure(timeoutFailures++, maxRetries, toe);
402         } catch (IOException ie) {
403           handleConnectionFailure(ioFailures++, maxRetries, ie);
404         }
405       }
406     }
407 
408     /** Connect to the server and set up the I/O streams. It then sends
409      * a header to the server and starts
410      * the connection thread that waits for responses.
411      * @throws java.io.IOException e
412      */
413     protected synchronized void setupIOstreams()
414         throws IOException, InterruptedException {
415 
416       if (socket != null || shouldCloseConnection.get()) {
417         return;
418       }
419 
420       if (failedServers.isFailedServer(remoteId.getAddress())) {
421         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
422           LOG.debug("Not trying to connect to " + remoteId.getAddress() +
423               " this server is in the failed servers list");
424         }
425         IOException e = new FailedServerException(
426             "This server is in the failed servers list: " + remoteId.getAddress());
427         markClosed(e);
428         close();
429         throw e;
430       }
431 
432       try {
433         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
434           LOG.debug("Connecting to "+remoteId);
435         }
436         setupConnection();
437         this.in = new DataInputStream(new BufferedInputStream
438             (new PingInputStream(NetUtils.getInputStream(socket))));
439         this.out = new DataOutputStream
440             (new BufferedOutputStream(NetUtils.getOutputStream(socket)));
441         writeHeader();
442 
443         // update last activity time
444         touch();
445 
446         // start the receiver thread after the socket connection has been set up
447         start();
448       } catch (Throwable t) {
449         failedServers.addToFailedServers(remoteId.address);
450         IOException e;
451         if (t instanceof IOException) {
452           e = (IOException)t;
453         } else {
454           e = new IOException("Could not set up IO Streams", t);
455         }
456         markClosed(e);
457         close();
458 
459         throw e;
460       }
461     }
462 
463     protected void closeConnection() {
464       // close the current connection
465       if (socket != null) {
466         try {
467           socket.close();
468         } catch (IOException e) {
469           LOG.warn("Not able to close a socket", e);
470         }
471       }
472       // set socket to null so that the next call to setupIOstreams
473       // can start the process of connect all over again.
474       socket = null;
475     }
476 
477     /**
478      *  Handle connection failures
479      *
480      * If the current number of retries is equal to the max number of retries,
481      * stop retrying and throw the exception; Otherwise backoff N seconds and
482      * try connecting again.
483      *
484      * This Method is only called from inside setupIOstreams(), which is
485      * synchronized. Hence the sleep is synchronized; the locks will be retained.
486      *
487      * @param curRetries current number of retries
488      * @param maxRetries max number of retries allowed
489      * @param ioe failure reason
490      * @throws IOException if max number of retries is reached
491      */
492     private void handleConnectionFailure(
493         int curRetries, int maxRetries, IOException ioe) throws IOException {
494 
495       closeConnection();
496 
497       // throw the exception if the maximum number of retries is reached
498       if (curRetries >= maxRetries) {
499         throw ioe;
500       }
501 
502       // otherwise back off and retry
503       try {
504         Thread.sleep(failureSleep);
505       } catch (InterruptedException ignored) {}
506 
507       LOG.info("Retrying connect to server: " + remoteId.getAddress() +
508         " after sleeping " + failureSleep + "ms. Already tried " + curRetries +
509         " time(s).");
510     }
511 
512     /* Write the header for each connection
513      * Out is not synchronized because only the first thread does this.
514      */
515     private void writeHeader() throws IOException {
516       out.write(HBaseServer.HEADER.array());
517       out.write(HBaseServer.CURRENT_VERSION);
518       //When there are more fields we can have ConnectionHeader Writable.
519       DataOutputBuffer buf = new DataOutputBuffer();
520       header.write(buf);
521 
522       int bufLen = buf.getLength();
523       out.writeInt(bufLen);
524       out.write(buf.getData(), 0, bufLen);
525     }
526 
527     /* wait till someone signals us to start reading RPC response or
528      * it is idle too long, it is marked as to be closed,
529      * or the client is marked as not running.
530      *
531      * Return true if it is time to read a response; false otherwise.
532      */
533     @SuppressWarnings({"ThrowableInstanceNeverThrown"})
534     protected synchronized boolean waitForWork() {
535       if (calls.isEmpty() && !shouldCloseConnection.get()  && running.get())  {
536         long timeout = maxIdleTime-
537               (System.currentTimeMillis()-lastActivity.get());
538         if (timeout>0) {
539           try {
540             wait(timeout);
541           } catch (InterruptedException ignored) {}
542         }
543       }
544 
545       if (!calls.isEmpty() && !shouldCloseConnection.get() && running.get()) {
546         return true;
547       } else if (shouldCloseConnection.get()) {
548         return false;
549       } else if (calls.isEmpty()) { // idle connection closed or stopped
550         markClosed(null);
551         return false;
552       } else { // get stopped but there are still pending requests
553         markClosed((IOException)new IOException().initCause(
554             new InterruptedException()));
555         return false;
556       }
557     }
558 
559     public InetSocketAddress getRemoteAddress() {
560       return remoteId.getAddress();
561     }
562 
563     /* Send a ping to the server if the time elapsed
564      * since last I/O activity is equal to or greater than the ping interval
565      */
566     protected synchronized void sendPing() throws IOException {
567       long curTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
568       if ( curTime - lastActivity.get() >= pingInterval) {
569         lastActivity.set(curTime);
570         //noinspection SynchronizeOnNonFinalField
571         synchronized (this.out) {
572           out.writeInt(PING_CALL_ID);
573           out.flush();
574         }
575       }
576     }
577 
578     @Override
579     public void run() {
580       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
581         LOG.debug(getName() + ": starting, having connections "
582             + connections.size());
583 
584       try {
585         while (waitForWork()) {//wait here for work - read or close connection
586           receiveResponse();
587         }
588       } catch (Throwable t) {
589         LOG.warn("Unexpected exception receiving call responses", t);
590         markClosed(new IOException("Unexpected exception receiving call responses", t));
591       }
592 
593       close();
594 
595       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
596         LOG.debug(getName() + ": stopped, remaining connections "
597             + connections.size());
598     }
599 
600     /* Initiates a call by sending the parameter to the remote server.
601      * Note: this is not called from the Connection thread, but by other
602      * threads.
603      */
604     protected void sendParam(Call call) {
605       if (shouldCloseConnection.get()) {
606         return;
607       }
608 
609       // For serializing the data to be written.
610 
611       final DataOutputBuffer d = new DataOutputBuffer();
612       try {
613         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
614           LOG.debug(getName() + " sending #" + call.id);
615 
616         d.writeInt(0xdeadbeef); // placeholder for data length
617         d.writeInt(call.id);
618         call.param.write(d);
619         byte[] data = d.getData();
620         int dataLength = d.getLength();
621         // fill in the placeholder
622         Bytes.putInt(data, 0, dataLength - 4);
623         //noinspection SynchronizeOnNonFinalField
624         synchronized (this.out) { // FindBugs IS2_INCONSISTENT_SYNC
625           out.write(data, 0, dataLength);
626           out.flush();
627         }
628       } catch(IOException e) {
629         markClosed(e);
630       } finally {
631         //the buffer is just an in-memory buffer, but it is still polite to
632         // close early
633         IOUtils.closeStream(d);
634       }
635     }
636 
637     /* Receive a response.
638      * Because only one receiver, so no synchronization on in.
639      */
640     protected void receiveResponse() {
641       if (shouldCloseConnection.get()) {
642         return;
643       }
644       touch();
645 
646       try {
647         // See HBaseServer.Call.setResponse for where we write out the response.
648         // It writes the call.id (int), a flag byte, then optionally the length
649         // of the response (int) followed by data.
650 
651         // Read the call id.
652         int id = in.readInt();
653 
654         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
655           LOG.debug(getName() + " got value #" + id);
656         Call call = calls.get(id);
657 
658         // Read the flag byte
659         byte flag = in.readByte();
660         boolean isError = ResponseFlag.isError(flag);
661         if (ResponseFlag.isLength(flag)) {
662           // Currently length if present is unused.
663           in.readInt();
664         }
665         int state = in.readInt(); // Read the state.  Currently unused.
666         if (isError) {
667           if (call != null) {
668             //noinspection ThrowableInstanceNeverThrown
669             call.setException(new RemoteException(WritableUtils.readString(in),
670                 WritableUtils.readString(in)));
671           }
672         } else {
673           Writable value = ReflectionUtils.newInstance(valueClass, conf);
674           value.readFields(in);                 // read value
675           // it's possible that this call may have been cleaned up due to a RPC
676           // timeout, so check if it still exists before setting the value.
677           if (call != null) {
678             call.setValue(value);
679           }
680         }
681         calls.remove(id);
682       } catch (IOException e) {
683         if (e instanceof SocketTimeoutException && remoteId.rpcTimeout > 0) {
684           // Clean up open calls but don't treat this as a fatal condition,
685           // since we expect certain responses to not make it by the specified
686           // {@link ConnectionId#rpcTimeout}.
687           closeException = e;
688         } else {
689           // Since the server did not respond within the default ping interval
690           // time, treat this as a fatal condition and close this connection
691           markClosed(e);
692         }
693       } finally {
694         if (remoteId.rpcTimeout > 0) {
695           cleanupCalls(remoteId.rpcTimeout);
696         }
697       }
698     }
699 
700     protected synchronized void markClosed(IOException e) {
701       if (shouldCloseConnection.compareAndSet(false, true)) {
702         closeException = e;
703         notifyAll();
704       }
705     }
706 
707     /** Close the connection. */
708     protected synchronized void close() {
709       if (!shouldCloseConnection.get()) {
710         LOG.error("The connection is not in the closed state");
711         return;
712       }
713 
714       // release the resources
715       // first thing to do;take the connection out of the connection list
716       synchronized (connections) {
717         connections.remove(remoteId, this);
718       }
719 
720       // close the streams and therefore the socket
721       IOUtils.closeStream(out);
722       IOUtils.closeStream(in);
723 
724       // clean up all calls
725       if (closeException == null) {
726         if (!calls.isEmpty()) {
727           LOG.warn(
728               "A connection is closed for no cause and calls are not empty");
729 
730           // clean up calls anyway
731           closeException = new IOException("Unexpected closed connection");
732           cleanupCalls();
733         }
734       } else {
735         // log the info
736         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
737           LOG.debug("closing ipc connection to " + remoteId.address + ": " +
738               closeException.getMessage(),closeException);
739         }
740 
741         // cleanup calls
742         cleanupCalls();
743       }
744       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
745         LOG.debug(getName() + ": closed");
746     }
747 
748     /* Cleanup all calls and mark them as done */
749     protected void cleanupCalls() {
750       cleanupCalls(0);
751     }
752 
753     protected void cleanupCalls(long rpcTimeout) {
754       Iterator<Entry<Integer, Call>> itor = calls.entrySet().iterator();
755       while (itor.hasNext()) {
756         Call c = itor.next().getValue();
757         long waitTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - c.getStartTime();
758         if (waitTime >= rpcTimeout) {
759           if (this.closeException == null) {
760             // There may be no exception in the case that there are many calls
761             // being multiplexed over this connection and these are succeeding
762             // fine while this Call object is taking a long time to finish
763             // over on the server; e.g. I just asked the regionserver to bulk
764             // open 3k regions or its a big fat multiput into a heavily-loaded
765             // server (Perhaps this only happens at the extremes?)
766             this.closeException = new CallTimeoutException("Call id=" + c.id +
767               ", waitTime=" + waitTime + ", rpcTimetout=" + rpcTimeout);
768           }
769           c.setException(this.closeException);
770           synchronized (c) {
771             c.notifyAll();
772           }
773           itor.remove();
774         } else {
775           break;
776         }
777       }
778       try {
779         if (!calls.isEmpty()) {
780           Call firstCall = calls.get(calls.firstKey());
781           long maxWaitTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - firstCall.getStartTime();
782           if (maxWaitTime < rpcTimeout) {
783             rpcTimeout -= maxWaitTime;
784           }
785         }
786         if (!shouldCloseConnection.get()) {
787           closeException = null;
788           if (socket != null) {
789             socket.setSoTimeout((int) rpcTimeout);
790           }
791         }
792       } catch (SocketException e) {
793         LOG.debug("Couldn't lower timeout, which may result in longer than expected calls");
794       }
795     }
796   }

825   /** Result collector for parallel calls. */
826   protected static class ParallelResults {
827     protected final Writable[] values;
828     protected int size;
829     protected int count;
830 
831     public ParallelResults(int size) {
832       this.values = new Writable[size];
833       this.size = size;
834     }
835 
836     /*
837      * Collect a result.
838      */
839     synchronized void callComplete(ParallelCall call) {
840       // FindBugs IS2_INCONSISTENT_SYNC
841       values[call.index] = call.value;            // store the value
842       count++;                                    // count it
843       if (count == size)                          // if all values are in
844         notify();                                 // then notify waiting caller
845     }
846   }

924   /** Stop all threads related to this client.  No further calls may be made
925    * using this client. */
926   public void stop() {
927     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
928       LOG.debug("Stopping client");
929     }
930 
931     if (!running.compareAndSet(true, false)) {
932       return;
933     }
934 
935     // wake up all connections
936     synchronized (connections) {
937       for (Connection conn : connections.values()) {
938         conn.interrupt();
939       }
940     }
941 
942     // wait until all connections are closed
943     while (!connections.isEmpty()) {
944       try {
945         Thread.sleep(100);
946       } catch (InterruptedException ignored) {
947       }
948     }
949   }

970   /** Make a call, passing <code>param</code>, to the IPC server running at
971    * <code>address</code> which is servicing the <code>protocol</code> protocol,
972    * with the <code>ticket</code> credentials, returning the value.
973    * Throws exceptions if there are network problems or if the remote code
974    * threw an exception. */
975   public Writable call(Writable param, InetSocketAddress addr,
976                        Class<? extends VersionedProtocol> protocol,
977                        User ticket, int rpcTimeout)
978       throws InterruptedException, IOException {
979     Call call = new Call(param);
980     Connection connection = getConnection(addr, protocol, ticket, rpcTimeout, call);
981     connection.sendParam(call);                 // send the parameter
982     boolean interrupted = false;
983     //noinspection SynchronizationOnLocalVariableOrMethodParameter
984     synchronized (call) {
985       while (!call.done) {
986         if (connection.shouldCloseConnection.get()) {
987           throw new IOException("Unexpected closed connection");
988         }
989         try {
990           call.wait(1000);                       // wait for the result
991         } catch (InterruptedException ignored) {
992           // save the fact that we were interrupted
993           interrupted = true;
994         }
995       }
996 
997       if (interrupted) {
998         // set the interrupt flag now that we are done waiting
999         Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1000       }
1001 
1002       if (call.error != null) {
1003         if (call.error instanceof RemoteException) {
1004           call.error.fillInStackTrace();
1005           throw call.error;
1006         }
1007         // local exception
1008         throw wrapException(addr, call.error);
1009       }
1010       return call.value;
1011     }
1012   }

1014   /**
1015    * Take an IOException and the address we were trying to connect to
1016    * and return an IOException with the input exception as the cause.
1017    * The new exception provides the stack trace of the place where
1018    * the exception is thrown and some extra diagnostics information.
1019    * If the exception is ConnectException or SocketTimeoutException,
1020    * return a new one of the same type; Otherwise return an IOException.
1021    *
1022    * @param addr target address
1023    * @param exception the relevant exception
1024    * @return an exception to throw
1025    */
1026   @SuppressWarnings({"ThrowableInstanceNeverThrown"})
1027   protected IOException wrapException(InetSocketAddress addr,
1028                                          IOException exception) {
1029     if (exception instanceof ConnectException) {
1030       //connection refused; include the host:port in the error
1031       return (ConnectException)new ConnectException(
1032            "Call to " + addr + " failed on connection exception: " + exception)
1033                     .initCause(exception);
1034     } else if (exception instanceof SocketTimeoutException) {
1035       return (SocketTimeoutException)new SocketTimeoutException(
1036            "Call to " + addr + " failed on socket timeout exception: "
1037                       + exception).initCause(exception);
1038     } else {
1039       return (IOException)new IOException(
1040            "Call to " + addr + " failed on local exception: " + exception)
1041                                  .initCause(exception);
1042 
1043     }
1044   }

1046   /** Makes a set of calls in parallel.  Each parameter is sent to the
1047    * corresponding address.  When all values are available, or have timed out
1048    * or errored, the collected results are returned in an array.  The array
1049    * contains nulls for calls that timed out or errored.
1050    * @param params writable parameters
1051    * @param addresses socket addresses
1052    * @return  Writable[]
1053    * @throws IOException e
1054    * @deprecated Use {@link #call(Writable[], InetSocketAddress[], Class, User)} instead
1055    */
1056   @Deprecated
1057   public Writable[] call(Writable[] params, InetSocketAddress[] addresses)
1058     throws IOException, InterruptedException {
1059     return call(params, addresses, null, null);
1060   }
1061 
1062   /** Makes a set of calls in parallel.  Each parameter is sent to the
1063    * corresponding address.  When all values are available, or have timed out
1064    * or errored, the collected results are returned in an array.  The array
1065    * contains nulls for calls that timed out or errored.  */
1066   public Writable[] call(Writable[] params, InetSocketAddress[] addresses,
1067                          Class<? extends VersionedProtocol> protocol,
1068                          User ticket)
1069       throws IOException, InterruptedException {
1070     if (addresses.length == 0) return new Writable[0];
1071 
1072     ParallelResults results = new ParallelResults(params.length);
1073     // TODO this synchronization block doesnt make any sense, we should possibly fix it
1074     //noinspection SynchronizationOnLocalVariableOrMethodParameter
1075     synchronized (results) {
1076       for (int i = 0; i < params.length; i++) {
1077         ParallelCall call = new ParallelCall(params[i], results, i);
1078         try {
1079           Connection connection =
1080               getConnection(addresses[i], protocol, ticket, 0, call);
1081           connection.sendParam(call);             // send each parameter
1082         } catch (IOException e) {
1083           // log errors
1084           LOG.info("Calling "+addresses[i]+" caught: " +
1085                    e.getMessage(),e);
1086           results.size--;                         //  wait for one fewer result
1087         }
1088       }
1089       while (results.count != results.size) {
1090         try {
1091           results.wait();                    // wait for all results
1092         } catch (InterruptedException ignored) {}
1093       }
1094 
1095       return results.values;
1096     }
1097   }

1099   /* Get a connection from the pool, or create a new one and add it to the
1100    * pool.  Connections to a given host/port are reused. */
1101   protected Connection getConnection(InetSocketAddress addr,
1102                                    Class<? extends VersionedProtocol> protocol,
1103                                    User ticket,
1104                                    int rpcTimeout,
1105                                    Call call)
1106                                    throws IOException, InterruptedException {
1107     if (!running.get()) {
1108       // the client is stopped
1109       throw new IOException("The client is stopped");
1110     }
1111     Connection connection;
1112     /* we could avoid this allocation for each RPC by having a
1113      * connectionsId object and with set() method. We need to manage the
1114      * refs for keys in HashMap properly. For now its ok.
1115      */
1116     ConnectionId remoteId = new ConnectionId(addr, protocol, ticket, rpcTimeout);
1117     synchronized (connections) {
1118       connection = connections.get(remoteId);
1119       if (connection == null) {
1120         connection = createConnection(remoteId);
1121         connections.put(remoteId, connection);
1122       }
1123     }
1124     connection.addCall(call);
1125 
1126     //we don't invoke the method below inside "synchronized (connections)"
1127     //block above. The reason for that is if the server happens to be slow,
1128     //it will take longer to establish a connection and that will slow the
1129     //entire system down.
1130     //Moreover, if the connection is currently created, there will be many threads
1131     // waiting here; as setupIOstreams is synchronized. If the connection fails with a
1132     // timeout, they will all fail simultaneously. This is checked in setupIOstreams.
1133     connection.setupIOstreams();
1134     return connection;
1135   }

1137   /**
1138    * This class holds the address and the user ticket. The client connections
1139    * to servers are uniquely identified by <remoteAddress, ticket>
1140    */
1141   protected static class ConnectionId {
1142     final InetSocketAddress address;
1143     final User ticket;
1144     final int rpcTimeout;
1145     Class<? extends VersionedProtocol> protocol;
1146     private static final int PRIME = 16777619;
1147 
1148     ConnectionId(InetSocketAddress address,
1149         Class<? extends VersionedProtocol> protocol,
1150         User ticket,
1151         int rpcTimeout) {
1152       this.protocol = protocol;
1153       this.address = address;
1154       this.ticket = ticket;
1155       this.rpcTimeout = rpcTimeout;
1156     }
1157 
1158     InetSocketAddress getAddress() {
1159       return address;
1160     }
1161 
1162     Class<? extends VersionedProtocol> getProtocol() {
1163       return protocol;
1164     }
1165 
1166     User getTicket() {
1167       return ticket;
1168     }
1169 
1170     @Override
1171     public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1172      if (obj instanceof ConnectionId) {
1173        ConnectionId id = (ConnectionId) obj;
1174        return address.equals(id.address) && protocol == id.protocol &&
1175               ((ticket != null && ticket.equals(id.ticket)) ||
1176                (ticket == id.ticket)) && rpcTimeout == id.rpcTimeout;
1177      }
1178      return false;
1179     }
1180 
1181     @Override  // simply use the default Object#hashcode() ?
1182     public int hashCode() {
1183       return (address.hashCode() + PRIME * (
1184                   PRIME * System.identityHashCode(protocol) ^
1185              (ticket == null ? 0 : ticket.hashCode()) )) ^ rpcTimeout;
1186     }
1187   }
